Class NetworkServer

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.server.connections.NetworkServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualServerProvider, Serializable, Runnable, Remote
public class NetworkServer extends Thread implements VirtualServerProvider, Serializable
Represents the entry point for any incoming connection to the MainServerController, for both protocols.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • NetworkServer

      public NetworkServer()
      Constructs a NetworkServer object, only initializing the ExecutorService.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init(String address, int tcpport, int rmiport)
      Properly sets all parameters to open the server to inbound connections.
      Parameters:
      address - IP address on which both protocols will be listening.
      tcpport - Port on which the TCP Socket will be opened.
      rmiport - Port on which the RMI Registy will be created.

    • init

      public void init(String address, int rmiport)
      Properly sets all parameters to open the server to inbound connections. TCP port to be randomly selected.
      Parameters:
      address - IP address on which both protocols will be listening.
      rmiport - Port on which the RMI Registy will be created.

    • startServer

      private void startServer()
      Starts both protocols with the values set using init(...) and creates the RMI Registry objects binding this object to an entry.

    • run

      public void run()
      Main loop of the NetworkServer, listening for incoming TCP connections.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • RMICleanup

      private Thread RMICleanup()
      Returns:
      A thread object related to the proper closure of any remnants of the RMI Server.

    • TCPCleanup

      private Thread TCPCleanup()
      Returns:
      A thread object related to the proper closure of any remnants of the TCP Server.

    • accept

      public VirtualServer accept(RMIClientConnection client) throws RemoteException
      Main entry method for any RMIClientConnection wishing to connect.
      Specified by:
      accept in interface VirtualServerProvider
      Parameters:
      client - RMIClientConnection Client stub object exported before connecting.
      Returns:
      VirtualServer Server stub object used by client to send messages, null if connection is refused.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If the underlying RMI TCP channel is disrupted in any unrecoverable way.
